item.title: Joanna add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "If music be the food of love, play on, Give me excess of it; that surfeiting, The appetite may sicken, and so die." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Joanna add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Joanna add a quote by William Shakespeare
Joanna add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Scott Westerfield
item.description: "The human heart is a strange vessel. Love and hatred can exist side by side." -- Scott Westerfield

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "This is how humans are: We question all our beliefs, except for the ones that we really believe in, and those we never think to question." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "The society whose citizens are willing to stand and fight is the one with the best chance of surviving long enough for history to even notice." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Stories never really end...even if the books like to pretend they do. Stories always go on. They don't end on the last page, any more than they begin on the first page." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Ann Rinaldi
item.description: "A person doesn't ask permission to fall in love; not even of themselves." -- Ann Rinaldi

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Catherine Gilbert Murdock
item.description: "When you don't talk, there's a lot of stuff that ends up not getting said." -- Catherine Gilbert Murdock

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Mary Stewart
item.description: "Every life has death and every light has shadow. Be content to stand in the light and let the shadow fall where it will." -- Mary Stewart

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Raymond E. Feist
item.description: "Life is problems. Living is solving problems." -- Raymond E. Feist

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Nothing in this world is harder than speaking the truth, nothing easier than flattery." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "They were renewed by love; the heart of each held infinite sources of life for the heart of the other." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "It is not the brains that matter most, but that which guides them — the character, the heart, generous qualities, progressive ideas." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Life is full of grief, to exactly the degree we allow ourselves to love other people." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Above all, don't lie to yourself. The man who lies to himself and listens to his own lie comes to a point that he cannot distinguish the truth within him, or around him, and so loses all respect for himself and for others. And having no respect he ceases to love." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "And that is how change happens. One gesture. One person. One moment at a time." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "To those who will see, the world waits." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "We're all strangers connected by what we reveal, what we share, what we take away--our stories. I guess that's what I love about books--they are thin strands of humanity that tether us to one another for a small bit of time, that make us feel less alone or even more comfortable with our aloneness, if need be." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Books may well be the only true magic." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "We had to survive to remember. Otherwise everything we were would disappear. Those people we loved would fade as though we'd never loved them, as if they'd never walked and talked and burned, forgetting them was the real evil. That was the hole of darkness." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "Some things don't last forever, but some things do. Like a good song, or a good book, or a good memory you can take out and unfold in your darkest times, pressing down on the corners and peering in close, hoping you still recognize the person you see there." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "There comes a time when the world gets quiet and the only thing left is your own heart. So you'd better learn the sound of it. Otherwise you'll never understand what it's saying." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Diane Duane
item.description: "Reading one book is like eating one potato chip." -- Diane Duane

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Yes: I am a dreamer. For a dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "Belief isn't simply a thing for fair times and bright days...What is belief - what is faith - if you don't continue in it after failure?...Anyone can believe in someone, or something that always succeeds...But failure...ah, now, that is hard to believe in, certainly and truly. Difficult enough to have value. Sometimes we just have to wait long enough...then we find out why exactly it was that we kept believing...There's always another secret." -- Brandon Sanderson
